item.title: You Can See Four Planets With The Naked Eye This Month, And Two With Binoculars - ABP Live
item.description:
You Can See Four Planets With The Naked Eye This Month, And Two With Binoculars

Publication Date: January 2023

Source: Associated Press

This month offers a stunning celestial spectacle as six planets align in a planetary parade, with four — Venus, Mars, Jupiter, and Saturn — visible to the naked eye.

Key Points

  • Venus, Mars, Jupiter, and Saturn can be seen without telescopes.
  • Uranus and Neptune are also visible with binoculars.
  • Clear nights are ideal for viewing this phenomenon.
  • January 17 and 18 feature Venus and Saturn appearing very close together.
  • The spectacle continues into February with the addition of Mercury.
“These multi-planet viewing opportunities aren’t super rare, but they don’t happen every year, so it’s worth checking it out.” - Preston Dyches, NASA

This month provides a unique opportunity for stargazers to witness multiple planets align, making it an exciting time for both amateur astronomers and casual observers.

item.title: Freezing Weather Expected, Trump Inauguration To Be Moved Indoors - NDTV
item.description:
Trump's Inauguration Moved Indoors Due to Freezing Weather

Date: January 20, 2021

Source: NDTV

The inauguration of Donald Trump as US president will take place indoors at the Capitol Rotunda due to an Arctic blast of freezing weather expected in Washington.

  • Trump announced the change via his app, Truth Social.
  • Past inaugurations have typically been held outdoors on the Capitol steps.
  • The last indoor inauguration was Ronald Reagan's in 1985.
  • Expected temperatures in Washington will be well below freezing on the day of the event.
  • Various dignitaries and guests will attend the indoor ceremony.
  • Supporters can watch the inauguration live at Capital One Arena, where Trump plans to join them after the ceremony.
Trump stated, "The ceremonies in the Rotunda will be a very beautiful experience for all, and especially for the large TV audience!"

This decision ensures the safety of participants and attendees while still allowing for a significant public experience through live feeds.

item.title: Research questions ‘iron deficiency’ as key cause of anaemia in India - The Hindu
item.description:
Research questions ‘iron deficiency’ as key cause of anaemia in India

Published: January 17, 2025

Source: The Hindu

A recent study suggests that the traditional belief that iron deficiency is the primary cause of anaemia in India may be outdated, highlighting alternative factors such as Vitamin B12 deficiency and air pollution. The findings call for a review of public health policies regarding anaemia.

  • The study was published in the European Journal of Clinical Nutrition.
  • Anaemia affects 34.9% of the population tested, but only 9% had iron-deficiency anaemia.
  • Prevalence of anaemia in women of reproductive age increased from 53.2% to 57.2% as per the latest National Family Health Survey.
  • Other causes of anaemia include deficiencies in nutrients like B12 or folate and environmental factors such as pollution.
  • The study indicates the need for diversified dietary policies and holistic approaches, rather than focusing solely on iron supplementation.
“The key is to diversify diets. We have to intervene with ensuring more fruits, milk and vegetables are made available to a wider population which will improve absorption of essential nutrients.” - Dr. Anura Kurpad

The findings of this study advocate for more comprehensive public health strategies to combat anaemia in India.

item.title: Who is Priya Saroj, Samajwadi Party MP rumoured to be engaged to Indian cricketer Rinku Singh? - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Who is Priya Saroj, Samajwadi Party MP rumored to be engaged to cricketer Rinku Singh?

Published on: January 17, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Media reports have surfaced claiming that Samajwadi Party MP Priya Saroj is engaged to Indian cricketer Rinku Singh.

  • Priya Saroj is a sitting Lok Sabha MP from Uttar Pradesh's Machhlishahr and a member of the Samajwadi Party.
  • She is an advocate by profession, holding an LLB from Amity University.
  • In the 2024 elections, she won against BJP's BP Saroj by 35,850 votes.
  • She is the daughter of Tufani Saroj, a senior Samajwadi Party leader.
  • Priya is on the parliamentary committee for social justice and empowerment.

Rinku Singh: He is a left-handed batter for the Indian cricket team and plays for Kolkata Knight Riders in the IPL. He gained fame in 2023 for hitting five consecutive sixes in a match.

Rinku Singh has been selected for India's upcoming T20I series against England starting January 22.

The engagement news remains unconfirmed by the families of both individuals.

item.title: Galaxy S25 series ‘secret’ AI features, price in India leaked ahead of January 22 Samsung Unpacked - The Financial Express
item.description:
Galaxy S25 Series Features and Pricing Leaked Ahead of Unpacked Event

Publication Date: January 20, 2025

Source: Financial Express

Samsung is set to unveil its Galaxy S25 series on January 22, 2025, and leaks have revealed details about its features and pricing in India.

  • Upcoming models include Galaxy S25, S25+, and S25 Ultra.
  • Features AI enhancements like Google Gemini for smart suggestions.
  • New “Morning Brief” feature aggregates daily important information for users.
  • Pricing in India expected to increase, with the S25 starting at Rs 84,999.
  • Improved video capabilities with “Nightography” and an Audio Eraser feature.
“The Galaxy S25 series will come with cutting-edge features, powered by the new Snapdragon 8 Elite chipset.”

The Galaxy S25 series is shaping up to be a significant upgrade over its predecessor, combining enhanced performance with innovative AI features.

item.title: Rishabh Pant 'Very Excited' Ahead Of Ranji Trophy Return. Report Says 'Virat Kohli Could Join For..... - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Rishabh Pant 'Very Excited' Ahead Of Ranji Trophy Return

Date: January 25, 2025 Source: NDTV

Indian wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant is enthusiastic about his participation in the upcoming Ranji Trophy season, marking his return to domestic cricket after several years.

  • Rishabh Pant's gear has arrived at the Delhi team's hotel ahead of their match against Saurashtra starting January 23.
  • Pant scored 255 runs in the recent Border-Gavaskar Trophy.
  • He made a remarkable comeback to cricket following a serious car accident in late 2022, including an impressive performance in the ICC T20 World Cup.
  • Pant last played in the Ranji Trophy during the 2017/18 season.
  • Virat Kohli might participate in Delhi's second match depending on his availability.
  • The BCCI has mandated participation in domestic matches for eligibility for national selection.
“Participation in Domestic Matches is mandatory for players to remain eligible for selection in the national team and for central contracts.” - BCCI

Pant's return to the Ranji Trophy could significantly bolster Delhi's chances, currently ranked fourth in their group.

item.title: U.S. Supreme Court upholds law banning TikTok - The Hindu
item.description:
U.S. Supreme Court upholds law banning TikTok

Date: January 17, 2025 | Source: The Hindu

The U.S. Supreme Court has upheld a law requiring TikTok's Chinese parent company, ByteDance, to divest the app or risk being banned on national security grounds, affecting its over 170 million American users.

  • The court's decision overturned a lower court's ruling.
  • The law was enacted by a bipartisan majority and highlights national security concerns regarding data collection by foreign adversaries.
  • TikTok has argued this law endangers First Amendment rights for U.S. users.
  • The law could lead to TikTok ceasing operations in the U.S. if no deal is reached before the deadline.
“There is no doubt that, for more than 170 million Americans, TikTok offers a distinctive and expansive outlet for expression...”

The ruling raises implications for free speech amidst growing tensions between the U.S. and China, with the incoming Trump administration signaling a willingness to negotiate a deal to keep TikTok operational.

item.title: India's Champions Trophy squad: Will Bumrah be ready in time? And what about Kuldeep? - ESPNcricinfo
item.description:
India's Champions Trophy squad: Will Bumrah be ready in time? And what about Kuldeep?

Publication Date: Not specified Source: ESPN Cricinfo

As India prepares for the Champions Trophy, key players Jasprit Bumrah and Kuldeep Yadav's fitness remains uncertain, leaving selectors in a dilemma.

  • No updates on Jasprit Bumrah's fitness after he suffered from back spasms during the Sydney Test.
  • Mohammed Shami recovers from surgery and is set to return to ODIs against England, with match fitness to be assessed ahead of the Champions Trophy.
  • Kuldeep Yadav's recovery from hernia surgery raises questions about his availability for the England ODIs.
  • Yashasvi Jaiswal's impressive domestic performance leads to speculation about his inclusion in the Champions Trophy squad.
  • KL Rahul likely to be the primary wicketkeeper, with competition from Rishabh Pant and others.
  • Selectors may opt for a combination of seam and spin-bowling allrounders for depth in batting.
“It is likely that Bumrah will be named in the 15 with an asterisk against his name.”

The status of key players' injuries may significantly impact India's approach in the upcoming Champions Trophy.

item.title: Urvashi Rautela apologises to Saif Ali Khan for her ignorant remark about the knife attack: ‘I feel ashamed’ - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Urvashi Rautela Apologizes for Indifferent Remarks About Saif Ali Khan's Knife Attack

Publication Date: Jan 17, 2025
Source: Hindustan Times

Actor Urvashi Rautela faced backlash for insensitive comments made regarding the knife attack on Saif Ali Khan, where she appeared tone-deaf while flaunting her jewelry. Following public outrage, she issued an apology acknowledging her ignorance of the situation's severity.

  • Urvashi Rautela faced heavy criticism for her comments about Saif Ali Khan's stabbing.
  • While expressing concern, she displayed her expensive jewelry, perceived as tone-deaf.
  • She issued a public apology to Saif Ali Khan, expressing regret for her earlier ignorance.
  • Saif Ali Khan was stabbed at his home and is recovering after surgery.
“Please accept my sincerest apologies for being so ignorant and insensitive.”

This incident highlights the importance of empathy and understands the gravity of situations affecting others.

Will do everything to make world more peaceful and safe: Trump, Xi hold phone call

The leaders of the United States and China highlighted their commitment to global peace and safety during a recent phone call.

item.title: Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra, Galaxy S25+ and Galaxy S25 Price in India Leaked Ahead of Galaxy Unpacked - Gadgets 360
item.description:
Here's How Much the Samsung Galaxy S25 Series Might Cost in India

Publication Date: January 18, 2023 | Source: Gadgets 360

The Samsung Galaxy S25 series is set to debut at the Galaxy Unpacked event on January 22, 2023. Recent leaks suggest a price increase over the previous Galaxy S24 series.

  • The base model Galaxy S25 may be priced at Rs. 84,999 for 12GB RAM and 256GB storage.
  • Galaxy S25+ could start at Rs. 1,04,999 for 12GB RAM and 256GB storage.
  • Galaxy S25 Ultra may be priced at Rs. 1,34,999 for the base 12GB+256GB model.
  • Expected price increases are attributed to the adoption of the new Snapdragon 8 Elite chipset.
“The slight price increase reflects the latest technology and market trends.”

As anticipation builds for the Galaxy Unpacked event, Samsung continues to accept reservations for the new S series smartphones, indicating strong market interest.

item.title: 'Emergency' movie review: From 'iron lady' to meek mimicry: Kangana's Indira falls short - Deccan Herald
item.description:
Emergency Movie Review: From 'Iron Lady' to Meek Mimicry

Published Date: 17 January 2025, Source: Deccan Herald

Director Kangana Ranaut's film Emergency attempts to portray a tumultuous phase in Indian democracy but falls short of delivering a compelling narrative, instead marred by melodrama and a lack of nuance.

  • The film opens with an extensive disclaimer about its historical inspirations.
  • Kangana portrays Indira Gandhi, focusing on her quirks rather than her commanding presence.
  • Characters like Jayaprakash Narayan and Atal Bihari Vajpayee break into musical performances, detracting from the gravity of the subject matter.
  • Significant historical events are packed into the script but often presented without sufficient context.
  • Vishak Nair's portrayal of Sanjay Gandhi stands out amidst other exaggerated performances.
“Indira's fixation on power led to her downfall. The absence of nuance and slapdash making sink Emergency. As for subtlety, rest in peace.”

The film tries to encapsulate Indira Gandhi's complex legacy but ultimately fails to resonate, lacking depth and a coherent storyline.

item.title: Cancer rate sees an alarming rise in young females; Know the most common cancers in women - The Times of India
item.description:
Cancer Rate Sees Alarming Rise in Young Females

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

The article discusses the concerning increase in cancer rates among young females, highlighting the most common types of cancers affecting women today.

  • The overall cancer rates in young females are rising significantly.
  • Breast cancer remains the most common cancer among women.
  • Other prevalent cancers include cervical cancer and ovarian cancer.
  • The article emphasizes the importance of early detection and regular check-ups.
“Early detection can lead to better outcomes for women battling cancer.”

This increase in cancer rates serves as a critical reminder of the necessity for education, awareness, and proactive health measures among young women.

item.title: Aman Jaiswal, Dhartiputra Nandini Actor Dies In Road Accident At 23 - Times Now
item.description:
Aman Jaiswal, Dhartiputra Nandini Actor Dies In Road Accident At 23

Publication Date: Not specified, Source: Times Now

Indian television actor Aman Jaiswal tragically died at the age of 23 in a road accident when he was hit by a truck while riding his bike. He died shortly after being taken to the hospital.

  • Aman Jaiswal was known for his role in the TV show Dhartiputra Nandini.
  • The accident occurred on the Jogeshwari Highway.
  • He died half an hour after being taken to HBT Trauma Hospital.
  • Director Dhiraj Mishra paid tribute to Aman on social media.
  • Aman was a talented singer and guitarist, and was popular on Instagram.
“You will live in our memories... God can be so cruel sometimes your death made me realize today... Good bye @aman__jazz” - Dhiraj Mishra

Aman's sudden demise has left his fans and the entertainment community in shock.

item.title: "What Have The Wives Done?" India Great Harbhajan Singh Slams Restricting Families On Team India Tou.. - NDTV Sports
item.description:
What Have The Wives Done?

Publication Date: January 25, 2025 Source: NDTV

In response to the BCCI's new directive limiting family presence during tours, former cricketer Harbhajan Singh criticized the decision, arguing that the focus should remain on improving players' performances rather than restricting family interactions.

  • The BCCI has introduced a 10-point directive aimed at enhancing team performance.
  • New rules include reduced time for players with family members and mandatory travel with the team.
  • Harbhajan emphasizes that performance issues should not be attributed to players’ families.
  • He believes the focus should be on the game itself and acknowledges the team's transitional period.
"What have the wives done? When performance is not good you say, don't allow wives and children. Have we lost because of them?" - Harbhajan Singh

Harbhajan also commented on the Indian team’s lack of unity in travel, calling for a cohesive approach.

item.title: Israel’s security Cabinet recommends approval of ceasefire in Gaza; awaits full Cabinet’s decision - The Hindu
item.description:
Israel’s security Cabinet recommends approval of ceasefire in Gaza; awaits full Cabinet’s decision

Date: January 17, 2025 Source: The Hindu

After months of conflict with Hamas, Israel’s security Cabinet has recommended approval for a ceasefire deal on January 17, 2025. This deal aims to pause the ongoing war and facilitate the release of hostages.

  • The ceasefire deal was announced by mediators Qatar and the U.S. on January 15, 2025.
  • This recommendation comes after Prime Minister Netanyahu confirmed an agreement to pause hostilities and begin releasing hostages.
  • The ceasefire could begin as early as January 19, 2025, pending approval from the full Cabinet.
  • The agreement aims to release 33 hostages in exchange for hundreds of imprisoned Palestinians.
  • Resistance from far-right coalition partners poses potential challenges to Netanyahu's government stability.
“If the ‘deal’ passes, we will leave the government with a heavy heart.” - Itamar Ben-Gvir, Israel's National Security Minister

The anticipated ceasefire holds the potential to dramatically alter the current situation in Gaza, but significant resistance exists within the Israeli government.

item.title: Emergency Twitter Review: Kangana Ranaut leaves audiences shook; fans call film must-watch, say ‘Kangana is Indira’ - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Kangana Ranaut’s Emergency released in theatres today. Here’s what the audience thought of her portrayal of Indira Gandhi

Date: January 17, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

On January 17, 2025, Kangana Ranaut’s film Emergency hit theaters, with audiences eager to see her representation of former Prime Minister Indira Gandhi. Fans took to social media to share their positive reactions to her impactful performance.

  • Fans praised Kangana Ranaut's transformative performance as Indira Gandhi.
  • Many highlighted the film's gripping narrative and high-quality direction and cinematography.
  • Audience reviews point to the film's significance, calling it a must-watch for every citizen.
One fan stated, “Must watch for every citizen. Film could have been even more powerful if the original version had been allowed to release.”

The film seems to have successfully captured the attention and admiration of viewers, with discussions on social media indicating a strong reception.

item.title: Israel’s Security Cabinet greenlights Gaza ceasefire deal, hostage release expected - Moneycontrol
item.description:
Israel’s Security Cabinet greenlights Gaza ceasefire deal, hostage release expected

Date: January 17, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

The Israeli Security Cabinet has recommended a ceasefire deal to pause the ongoing war with Hamas and facilitate the release of hostages.

  • The ceasefire deal is expected to begin on January 19, 2025.
  • It follows a cross-border attack by Hamas on October 7, 2023, which killed approximately 1,200 Israelis.
  • Over 46,000 Palestinians have reportedly died as a result of the conflict, with many casualties being women and children.
  • Despite the deal, Netanyahu's government faces opposition from far-right coalition partners.
“A deal is in place,” said Prime Minister Netanyahu, reflecting on the hostage situation.

The ceasefire represents a potential shift in the ongoing conflict, but the opposition could destabilize the current government structure.

item.title: 'Wanted to establish Nazi-style dictatorship': Telugu youth gets 8 years in prison for White House attack - The Times of India
item.description:
Telugu Youth Sentenced to 8 Years for Attempted White House Attack

Publication Date: Recent | Source: Times of India

An 8-year prison sentence has been handed down to a Telugu youth for attempting to carry out an attack on the White House, as part of a plan to establish a regime reminiscent of Nazi Germany.

  • The individual intended to create a 'Nazi-style dictatorship'.
  • Details of the case reveal a troubling ideology driving the actions of the youth.
  • The sentence demonstrates a strong judicial response to threats against national security.
“This sentence should serve as a warning that such ideologies and actions will not be tolerated.”

The case highlights a concerning intersection of ideology and criminal intent, emphasizing the importance of monitoring extremist movements.

item.title: James Webb Space Telescope Detects Supernova From 11.4 Billion Years Ago - Gadgets 360
item.description:
James Webb Space Telescope Detects Supernova From 11.4 Billion Years Ago

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: space.com

Astronomers, using the James Webb Space Telescope (JWST), have identified one of the oldest supernovas ever recorded, believed to have occurred approximately 11.4 billion years ago. This stellar explosion offers insights into the early universe's stellar evolution and cosmic processes following the Big Bang.

  • This supernova, designated AT 2023adsv, was triggered by a massive star approximately 20 times the size of the Sun.
  • It occurred in a massive early galaxy, providing insights into early stellar deaths.
  • Dr. David Coulter explained that early stars produced more powerful explosions than modern stars.
  • The event is part of the JWST Advanced Deep Extragalactic Survey (JADES).
  • The first generation of stars lacked heavy elements leading to more violent ends.
  • The launch of NASA's Nancy Grace Roman Space Telescope in 2026 will further these studies.
“These early stars were larger, hotter, and produced more powerful explosions than contemporary stars.” - Dr. David Coulter

The discovery of AT 2023adsv enhances the understanding of stellar evolution in the early universe.

item.title: How drinking coffee like THIS can sharpen memory, boost brain health - The Times of India
item.description:
How Drinking Coffee Without Sugar Can Boost Brain Health

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Times of India

New research highlights the benefits of consuming unsweetened coffee for brain health, revealing a correlation between unsweetened coffee intake and a lower risk of neurodegenerative diseases among older adults.

  • A study published in the American Journal of Clinical Nutrition showed that older adults who drink unsweetened coffee have a 29-30% reduced risk of Alzheimer's and related diseases.
  • Participants consuming two to three cups of coffee daily had a 45% lower risk of suicide compared to non-coffee drinkers.
  • Unsweetened coffee drinkers demonstrated a 43% lower mortality risk from neurodegenerative diseases.
  • Caffeine may enhance memory by increasing neurotransmitters that stabilize the blood-brain barrier.
  • The FDA recommends not exceeding 400 mg of caffeine daily, equivalent to about four cups of coffee.
“Drinking four to six cups of coffee daily was linked to a lower incidence of stroke and dementia.”

Overall, limiting sugar intake in coffee could have significant long-term benefits for brain health and well-being.

item.title: Unsweetened coffee's brain-boosting benefits: How it sharpens memory, cuts Alzheimer's risk - The Times of India
item.description:
Unsweetened Coffee's Brain-Boosting Benefits: How it Sharpens Memory, Cuts Alzheimer's Risk

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: American Journal of Clinical Nutrition

This article discusses the significant benefits of consuming unsweetened coffee, particularly its positive effects on brain health and reduced risk of neurodegenerative diseases like Alzheimer's, dementia, and Parkinson’s disease, according to a recent study.

  • Older adults with higher intake of unsweetened coffee show a 29-30% lower risk of Alzheimer’s.
  • Participants who did not sweeten their coffee had a 43% lower risk of mortality from these diseases.
  • Consumption of two to three cups of coffee daily is associated with a 45% lower risk of suicide.
  • Unsweetened coffee is rich in antioxidants and essential nutrients that contribute to lower risks of brain disorders.
“Caffeine may stimulate neurotransmitters that help improve memory and stabilize the blood-brain barrier.”

The findings highlight the advantages of opting for unsweetened coffee not only for its flavor but also for its health benefits, illustrating how dietary choices can significantly impact long-term cognitive health.

item.title: Wipro Q3 attrition rate rises to 15.3%; headcount down by 1,157 to 2,32,732 employees - Mint
item.description:
Wipro Q3 attrition rate rises to 15.3%; headcount down by 1,157 to 2,32,732 employees

Publication Date: January 17, 2025 | Source: Live Mint

Wipro Ltd reported a voluntary attrition rate of 15.3% for Q3 of the financial year 2024-25, up from 14.2% in the same quarter last year. The company’s headcount decreased by 1,157 to a total of 2,32,732 employees.

  • Consolidated net profits increased by 24.5% YoY to ₹3,353.8 crore.
  • Revenue from operations rose nearly 1% to ₹22,319 crore.
  • Wipro declared an interim dividend of ₹6 per equity share, with a record date set for January 28, 2025.
“In a seasonally weak quarter, our strong in-quarter execution helped us deliver above the top end of our revenue guidance,” said Srini Pallia, CEO.

The company's shares dropped 2.15% to ₹281.85 ahead of the earnings announcement.

This increase in attrition and decrease in headcount suggests ongoing challenges in workforce retention within the IT sector.
